title: Trying to get riot's attention
body: Hi I was recently banned for "scripting" when I don't believe I have ever used scripts and trying to get into contact with a real riot employee has been fruitless. So i've come to the boards to try to get an actual response from riot they refuse to investigate this issue I spent alot of money on this acount and wouldn't throw it all away for elo thats just stupid honestly. Please don't just spam downvote because I got banned im actually trying to resolve this issue and this seems to be the only way to to get their attention I really need the support from the community here please and thank you for reading this.

replies.body:
> So i've come to the boards to try to get an actual response from riot they refuse to investigate this issue

Your account was investigated, and found to be using scripts, which is why it was banned for scripting.

I know you want to be careful to not reveal how your script detection works, but i hope you understand how the system feels a bit... surreptitious, cloak and dagger, idk i'm struggling with word choice here. Not saying this guy did or didn't do anything, but there's no way for anyone to know that, and no way for him to prove otherwise. Food for thought.

Also the scripting ban is not likely real time: they could have flagged you account from ages ago.

Likely because if they're convinced that you've cheated, telling you why they believe so would only cause problems for them in their eyes.

Keeping detection methods as secret as possible is essential for a company to even attempt to stay ahead of the game. So they employ various tactics to throw any hint that they know how to detect a certain software, off the trail.

Things like;

Flagging an account that they've determined to be cheating, then mass banning all the accounts some time later. This is done so the players don't know which program or what behavior got them banned.

If cheaters know that a certain program is bound to get them banned, they'll just jump to the next program that is considered safe. The programmers making these exploits will also work harder to make their program undetectable.

Usually the kind of viruses you get watching movies are the really weak viruses. Only rarely do you get worse viruses, and even then they wouldn't specifically target the game, nor do I think they would trigger an automated ban(or anything of that sort). The only viruses you might get that could do that would be things like ransom-ware (maybe, or similar high damage viruses) due to its re-scripting of your files, but you would notice those.
